content.question: In the Bohr model of an atom, an electron moves along a circular orbit around a nucleus. The electron initially moves along an orbit of radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>. The magnitude of the initial net force exerted on the electron is <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Later, the atom transitions into a new energy state. The electron moves along an orbit of radius <math alttext="4 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi></math> when the atom is in the new state. The magnitude of the net force exerted on the electron is <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> when the atom is in the new state. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction F sub 2 over F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?
